settings.text: Announce something here

settings.title: Functional Art, One Door At A Time
We are the premier name in luxury steel interior doors.
settings.subtext: Weldwork is home to the nation’s finest luxury steel doors, completely hand-crafted right here in the USA.

settings.title: Weldwork offers two signature service tiers to best serve our clients
settings.subtext: Illuminate your interiors with steel doors that are made to fit your standard opening
settings.subtext2: Your choice of grid patterns, glass, hardware, and a full spectrum of powder coated finishes

settings.title1: Single Door - Mortise Lock - Full View

settings.subtext: Get inspired with some of our most recent  projects
settings.title: Featured Work

settings.subtext: Weldwork is proud to announce our quick ship product line.  Our ready made standard sizes are in stock and available for shipment in 6-8 weeks.
Weldwork is focused on providing the best customer service to our custom homebuilders.  We make the process easy!
Welcome Interior Designers!  We are excited to be your number one source for custom interior steel doors.
We wouldn’t be here without you!  Take a moment to explore our website where you’ll find a variety of specifications on all our door systems.

settings.title: Weldwork offers two signature service tiers to best serve our clients
You design it
settings.text: Start designing your dream door with our 3D online door builder. Our expert design team will view your design, and help you turn your vision into a reality.

settings.title: We build it
settings.text: Once your design is complete.  The next steps are cad drawings with our in house engineering team.  After signature approval your doors will go into production.

settings.title: We ship it to you
settings.text: Once manufacturing is complete, our shipping department will schedule a delivery date.  Please see our FAQ section for additional shipping information.

settings.subtext: HOW DOES A CUSTOM DOOR COME TO LIFE?
settings.title: Get it from your vision to your space in 3 easy steps
Gather inspiration.
settings.text: Follow us on instagram and pinterest to see some of our<br class="desktopClass"> latest door designs

settings.subtext:
We have a few questions before
we can complete your Quickship order.
settings.title: Pre-build Questionnaire
Astragal
settings.text: With double doors, an astragal is the steel divider that is mounted to the inactive door to close the gap between the two doors. It also acts as a stop for the active door. Each pair of Weldwork doors always comes with flush bolts installed at the top and bottom of each inactive door

settings.title: Active Door
settings.text: For double doors, the active door is the main door, or the one that you open and close.

settings.title: Bullet Hinge
settings.text: A bullet hinge is a type of hinge that is mounted to the jamb. Weldwork’s custom-made bullet hinges will upgrade your entryway while seamlessly blending with other traditional hinges around your home.

settings.title: Concealed Pivot Hinge
settings.text: A concealed pivot hinge is a premium hinge that is mounted within the top and bottom of your door, rather than to the jamb, creating a nearly invisible hinge system that rotates in and out seamlessly.

settings.title: Deadbolt
settings.text: A deadbolt is a type of lock that features a bolt, or shaft, that protrudes from the active door into the strike plate installed on the inactive door. Deadbolts offer an extra layer of security.

settings.title: Dummy Handle
settings.text: A dummy handle is a handleset that does not have a latching or locking function and does not turn. It is mounted on an inactive door to match the appearance of the active door and can be used to push and pull a door closed.

settings.title: Flushbolt
settings.text: A flush bolt keeps the inactive, or secondary, door in a pair of double doors locked and secured in place. It is flush-mounted, meaning it’s hidden, and placed at the top and bottom edges of the inactive door.

settings.title: Flanges
settings.text: A flange is a custom profile that is fitted to the frame behind the door. It is typically what weatherstripping is installed to and acts as a door stop.

settings.title: Glass Stops
settings.text: The .½” x .½” steel glass stop is what holds the glass in place. Whether you opt for true or simulated divided glass, Weldwork doors are glazed with a non-removable glass stop on one side and a ½” x ½” removable one on the other.

settings.title: Glazing
settings.text: Glazing is the glass in your door or fixed partition. Whether you want your door to put your room on full display or add privacy, Weldwork offers a variety of luxury glazing options to achieve your desired goal without compromising light.

settings.title: Handing
settings.text: Handing is what determines which way your door swings or slides. Please see the Weldwork Handing Chart.

settings.title: Inactive Door
settings.text: The stationary door that your active door latches into.

settings.title: Jambs
settings.text: Door jambs are the outer frames of the door system that the door mounts to and the hardware latches into.  Weldwork provides a custom 1” x 1.5” jamb for all of our bullet hinge doors.

settings.title: Mullion
settings.text: Mullions are the grid patterns of steel that separate panels of glass in a door. Weldwork offers a variety of mullion widths and patterns to complement any design aesthetic.

settings.title: Partition Door
settings.text: Partition doors are installed in fixed partitions, allowing you to block off a space and create a separate room. These are ideal for offices, vestibules, lofts, and entryways.

settings.title: Privacy Handle
settings.text: A privacy handle is typically used on a bedroom or bathroom door. It does not have a key and is instead locked from one side using a twist or button lock.

settings.title: Roller catch
settings.text: For interior doors, a roller catch is an almost invisible piece of hardware that is mounted to the top of the door to keep the door in a closed position when shut. This is similar to a ball catch on most closet doors in your home.

settings.title: Sidelights
settings.text: Sidelights are tall, narrow pieces of glass that can be placed on one or both sides of your door. They can brighten up a space by allowing more light in.

settings.title: Simulated Divided Glass
settings.text: Simulated divided glass allows you to create any grid pattern you’d like with one pane of glass and smaller mullions.

settings.title: Sliding Barn Door
settings.text: Sliding barn doors are mounted adjacent to a wall on an exposed barn track. They efficiently slide open and closed, offering space-saving design and a modern, industrial aesthetic.

settings.title: Sliding Track Door
settings.text: Weldwork’s sliding track doors are elegant sliding doors that stack on top of fixed panels and smoothly slide open and closed. They’re ideal for spaces like a closet where traditional swinging doors aren’t an option.

settings.title: Soft Close
settings.text: A soft close and open system slows the speed of a track door and cushions its movement, allowing the door to gently open and close in complete silence. This is perfect for younger kids to help prevent finger slamming. This feature only comes in 30” doors or larger.

settings.title: Strike Plate
settings.text: A strike plate is the metal plate installed on the door jamb across from the deadbolt. It is where the deadbolt and latch connect when the door is closed.

settings.title: Surface Mounted Pivot Door
settings.text: A surface mounted pivot door is equipped with a visible pivot hinge that is mounted to the top and bottom of the frame, rather than to the jamb. This creates a bold, contemporary appearance.

settings.title: Sweeps
settings.text: A door sweep is a strip of flexible material that is installed at the bottom of a door to help control the climate from one room to another. These are typically used in wine rooms, shower doors, or to help with additional sounds deadening.

settings.title: Tempered Glass
settings.text: Tempered glass is glass that has been strengthened. When broken, it fractures into relatively harmless pieces rather than sharp shards, making it much safer than ordinary glass.

settings.title: True Divided Glass
settings.text: True divided lite doors have multiple panes of individual glass that are separated by mullions.

settings.title: Weatherstripping or Seals
settings.text: A material that’s installed around the door system to seal off a room. These are typically used in wine rooms, shower doors, or to help with additional sounds deadening.

settings.title: 100% In-house
settings.text: Not a single step is outsourced. "Brief description of internal process copy. "Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi

settings.title: Proud of our work
settings.subtext: Our process has been refined for years, and our in-house men have the technical skills boasting years of experience. We are truly passionate about our product. Taking pictures shining our achievements on social media. Every day we are excited to build our doors, and feel rewarded when we see the outcome.

settings.HeadingText:
Our doors are the
definition of funcional art
settings.richtext2: All of our production is done by us, 100% in-house. This means that we always ensure the highest level of finish with every single project.
settings.richtext3: This is the only thing we do: been building doors since the 1970s. Our technical skills have been refined with years of experience.
settings.richtext4: Our product doesn't get stuck in canals - Made in USA
